abstract: Tells the observer that the app received a push token after you create a channel manager.

overview:
## Discussion

The framework provides a token to this method after you initialize [doc://com.apple.pushtotalk/documentation/PushToTalk/PTChannelManager]. The token isn’t active until a person joins the channel. If they leave the channel, you need to wait until they rejoin to resume notifications.

When you send push notifications, the `apns-topic` header field needs to contain your app’s bundle identifier wit`h` the `.voip-ptt` suffix.

# channelManager(_:receivedEphemeralPushToken:)

**Instance Method**

Tells the observer that the app received a push token after you create a channel manager.

## Declaration

```swift
func channelManager(_ channelManager: PTChannelManager, receivedEphemeralPushToken pushToken: Data)
```

## Parameters

- **channelManager**: The channel manager.
- **pushToken**: The ephemeral push token.

## Discussion

The framework provides a token to this method after you initialize [doc://com.apple.pushtotalk/documentation/PushToTalk/PTChannelManager]. The token isn’t active until a person joins the channel. If they leave the channel, you need to wait until they rejoin to resume notifications.



When you send push notifications, the `apns-topic` header field needs to contain your app’s bundle identifier wit`h` the `.voip-ptt` suffix.
title: channelManager(_:receivedEphemeralPushToken:)
